main event: A spherical object approximately 15 feet in diameter, white in color, was observed at an elevation of 30 feet, reportedly stationary for about 3 minutes in Las Vegas, Nevada.
interesting points: The object was seen at 0411/0215Z on 10 Jan 54., The observation was confirmed to potentially be a balloon released from Nellis AFB., The observer, Mr. J. S. Henderson, was a teacher and had prior service as an Air Force pilot., The observation involved no discernible sound or negative features from the object., The sighting coincided with other reports of a meteor flash seen across three states.
witness description: Mr. J. S. Henderson, teacher with 11 years service as an Air Force pilot
